intro: Phyllostegia lydgatei, commonly known as the Lydgate's strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and showy, tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
